intro: Noccaeopsis kamtschatica, commonly known as the Kamtschatskian lichen, is a species of foliose lichen belonging to the family Parmeliaceae. It is characterized by its greenish-gray thallus with a distinctive, finely granular surface. The lichen typically grows on tree bark, stone, and soil in temperate to subarctic regions. It contains various secondary metabolites, including atranorin and fumarprotocetraric acid. Noccaeopsis kamtschatica is often found in forested areas and is used in traditional medicine in some regions.
